children.name: name
children.definition: what sb is called :
examples: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
What’s your last name?

children.name: have a name
examples: All their children have French names.

children.name: give sb a name
examples: They gave their children unusual names.

children.name: use a name
children.definition: tell people that you have a particular name
examples: She may be using a false name.

children.name: take a name
children.definition: choose to have a new name
examples: Are you going to take your husband’s name when you get married?

children.name: change your name
examples: Many immigrants changed their names to seem more American.

children.name: give
children.definition: sb
examples: your name(= tell someone your name, especially someone in an official position )I gave my name to the receptionist.

children.name: know sb’s name
examples: His first name is Tom, but I don’t know his last name.

children.name: use sb’s name
children.definition: say their name when speaking to them
examples: I didn’t know him well enough to use his first name.

children.name: call sb’s name
children.definition: say someone’s name loudly, to get their attention
examples: He called Jean’s name, but there was no answer.

children.name: sign your name
examples: Sign your name here, please.

children.name: call sb by their first/full etc name
children.definition: use that name when you speak to them
examples: Everyone called him by his first name.

children.name: go by the name of ...
children.definition: be called something by people, often when that is not your real name
examples: As he had long red hair, he went by the name of Red.

children.name: know sb by name
children.definition: know their name
examples: The headteacher knew all the children by name.

children.name: greet sb by name
children.definition: use someone’s name when you see them
examples: The waiter greeted him by name.

children.name: full nameall your names
examples: Ayrton Senna’s full name was Ayrton Senna da Silva.

children.name: by the name of(= called something )
examples: He married a young lady by the name of Sarah Hunt.

children.name: under the name (of)(= using a different name from your real name )
examples: HH Munro wrote under the name Saki.

children.name: mention sb by name
examples: She didn’t mention you by name, but I’m sure it was you she was talking about.

children.name: first name
children.definition: /given nameUS formal the name that your parents choose for you when you are born, which in Western countries comes at the beginning of your full name: tên
examples: Her first name is Liz. I don’t know her surname.
Fill out the form with your last name, followed by your given name.

children.name: maiden name
children.definition: a woman’s family name before she married and began using her husband’s name: tên thời con gái
examples: My mother kept her maiden name when she got married. did not change her name to her husband’s name

children.name: last name
children.definition: /surnameA2/family name the name that you share with your family or husband. Most English speakers would saylast name.Surnamesounds slightly formal : tên họ
examples: I know his first name, but I can’t remember his last name.
Smith is the most common English surname.
Her first name is Sarah but I don't know her surname.
Can I have your last name?
Johnson is a common English family name.
At school they used to call each other by their surnames.
Joseph Conrad’s original family name was Korzeniowski.

children.name: carry on the family nameto pass on your family name to your children
examples: He died leaving no children to carry on the family name.

children.name: initials
children.definition: the first letters of each of your names: tên viết tắt
examples: There’s no need to write out your full name. Just your initials will do.

children.name: a suitcase marked with the initials JR
title
children.definition: a word such as Mrs, Miss, Ms, Mr, Dr, or Professor that you put before your name: tên hiệu
examples: The title ‘Ms’ became much more popular in the 1980s.

children.name: Christian name
children.definition: the name that Christian parents choose for a baby when they christen it: tên thánh
examples: My mother’s Christian name was Mary.

children.name: middle name
children.definition: /second nameUK  the name that comes between your first and last names: tên lót, tên đệm
examples: John F. Kennedy’s middle name was Fitzgerald.
Vicki won’t tell anyone her second name.

children.name: married name
children.definition: a woman’s family name after she gets married, if she uses her husband’s name :
examples: I don’t know what her married name is.

children.name: a name sb calls you because of your appearance or character
nickname
children.definition: a name that people call you because of your appearance, personality etc, which is not your real name : biệt danh
examples: At school he was given the nickname ‘Shorty’.
She got the nickname ‘Sis’ because her brother couldn’t pronounce her name when they were kids.
Mona - nicknamed Mo - had two teenage sons.

children.name: earn somebody a nicknamecause sb to have a particular nickname
examples: His black cloak earned him the nickname ‘Dracula’.
His fondness for rings had already earned him the nickname Ringo.

children.name: pet name
children.definition: a name you call sb who you like very much, for example your boyfriend or a young child in your family: tên thân mật
examples: Her pet name for him is Tiger.
She had pet names for all her grandchildren -- Curly, Longlegs, and Coco.

children.name: label
children.definition: a word used regularly as a description of sb or sth, showing that people think of them, often unfairly, as belonging to a particular type: mác, nhãn
examples: He objects to the sexist label - he doesn’t think he’s sexist at all.
At one time he was given the label ‘communist’ for his opposition to the Vietnam war.
He seems to be stuck with the label of 'troublemaker'.

children.name: tag
children.definition: a word or phrase used regularly in connection with a particular person’s name to describe their character, behaviour etc, especially in a way the person does not like: cái danh, danh xưng
examples: During one game I accidentally scored against my own side and acquired the tag ‘wrong way’ Jones.
I didn’t blame her for hating the ‘mayor’s ex-girlfriend’ tag.

children.name: sobriquet
children.definition: formala nickname – a very formal use : biệt hiệu
examples: Jackson gained the sobriquet ‘Stonewall’ at the Battle of Bull Run.

children.name: name
children.definition: what a thing, organization, or place is called
examples: I’ve forgotten the name of the street where she lives.
What’s the name of the street?
The name of the company has changed.
name for
Edo was the ancient name for Tokyo.
common name(= name that is used by ordinary people, not its scientific name )
The flower’s common name is forget-me-not.
get its name from sth
The village of Furnace got its name from the local industries of silver and iron smelting
the Chinese/French etc name for sth
The Chinese name for this plant means ‘cat’s ears’.

children.name: brand name
children.definition: the name given to a product by the company that makes it, often including the name of the company itself: tên nhãn hiệu
examples: Our customers prefer goods with brand names, such as Levis or Adidas.

children.name: title
children.definition: the name of a book, film, play, painting etc: tựa đề
examples: I’ve read one of her books, but I can’t remember the title.
What’s the title of this week’s assignment?

children.name: title of
examples: The title of this play is ‘Othello’.
The titleofEvelyn Waugh's first novel was 'Decline and Fall'.

children.name: under the title
examples: The film was released in the UK under the title ‘Maybe Baby’.
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually say that somethingis called ..., rather than sayingits title is ...:
The play'stitle is'Blasted'.➔The playis called'Blasted'.

children.name: place name
children.definition: the name of a place such as a town or an area of a country:
examples: In this part of the US many of the place names are of French origin.

children.name: code name
children.definition: a secret name for sth such as a military plan that you do not want other people to know about: biệt hiệu, tên mật
examples: Operation Overlord was the code name of the Normandy landing which took place in June 1944.

children.name: appellation
children.definition: formala name which describes sth – a very formal use : danh xưng, danh hiệu
examples: This fine city justifies its appellation ‘the Pearl of the Orient’.

children.name: a name that sb uses that is not their real name
stage name
children.definition: the name used by an actor, singer etc instead of their real name: nghệ danh
examples: Greta Garbo was the stage name of Greta Gustavson, born in Stockholm in 1905.
She began acting in her childhood under the stage name Marjorie Moore.

children.name: false name
children.definition: /ˌfɔːls ˈneɪm/  a name that someone uses instead of their real name, so that people will not find out who they really are:
examples: tên giả
▪ None of them had ever heard of Giles Williams, which was clearly a false name.
give/use a false name
dùngtên giả
▪ It is illegal to give a false name to your employer.
under a false nameusing a false name
dưới tên giả
▪ The woman was a foreigner travelling under a false name.

children.name: pseudonym
children.definition: /ˈsjuːdənɪmǁˈsuːdn-ɪm/  a name used by someone, especially a writer, instead of their real name:biệt hiệu, bút danh
examples: ▪ ‘Saki’ was the pseudonym of the writer H.H.Monroe.
under the pseudonym
dướibiệt hiệu, bút danh
using the pseudonym
▪ Morton wrote a weekly column in ‘The Daily Telegraph' under the pseudonym ’Beachcomber'.

children.name: pen name
children.definition: /pseudonymformal a name used by a writer instead of their real name: bút danh

children.name: The name Voltaire was in fact a pen name -- his real name was Francois Marie Arouet
examples: Mark Twain was his pen name. His real name was Samuel Clemens.

children.name: under the pen nameusing the pen name
examples: She wrote her novels under the pen name George Eliot, because the publishers would not accept a manuscript written by a woman.
She wrote under the pseudonym of George Eliot.

children.name: alias
children.definition: a word meaning ‘also known as’, used when giving sb’s real name, together with a different name they also use or are known by, especially because they are a criminal: được biết tới như
examples: Carlos, alias "The Jackal', is wanted by police in several countries.
We were introduced to Mrs Taylor, alias Meg Dods, author of the Housewife’s Manual.

children.name: aka/a.k.a.
children.definition: an abbreviation meaning ‘also known as’, used when giving sb’s real name together with a different name that they use or are known by, especially because they are a criminal: được biết tới như
examples: Standing there in front of me was Peter Downs, a.k.a. ‘The Leithgate Strangler’.

children.name: assumed name
children.definition: under an  if you do something under an assumed name, you do it using a name that is not your real name, especially in order to do it dishonestly or secretly: dưới tên giả
examples: He had rented a car under an assumed name.
She entered the private clinic under an assumed name, but the press still managed to find out.

children.name: go by the name of
children.definition: if sbgoes by the name of sth, they tell people that this is their name, when in fact it is not: thích được gọi là
examples: Herbert always hated his original name, so he went by the name of David.

children.name: The photographs resembled a man who lived in New York and went by the name of Ivan Denisovich
under the name of sth
children.definition: using a different name from your real name: dưới cái tên
examples: They registered at the hotel under the name of Smith.
Bollard set up a company under the name of Mr M. Roberts.

children.name: sb whose name is not known
anonymous
children.definition: sb who is anonymous does sth without saying what their name is, or their name is not known: giấu tên, vô danh, nặc danh
examples: The writer of the poem is anonymous.
anonymously[adv]
He sent the documents anonymously to a local newspaper.
anonymity[U]
If you are needed as a witness, your anonymity will be guaranteed we will promise that your name will not be made known to other people.

children.name: an anonymous donor/ benefactorsb who gives sth but does not say publicly who they are
examples: $50,000 has been given to the charity by an anonymous donor from Utah.
The money was donated by an anonymous benefactor .

children.name: anonymous letter/phone call etcfrom sb who does not say their name
examples: I received anonymous phone calls warning me not to go to the police about what I’d seen.

children.name: sb wishes to remain anonymous
examples: One source, who wished to remain anonymous, said that he had seen the woman go into hisroom.

children.name: unnamed
children.definition: an unnamedperson is someone whose name has not been made known publicly: không tên, vô danh
examples: ▪ An unnamed bidder paid $23 million for the painting.
▪ The newspaper received the information from an unnamed source.

children.name: unidentified
children.definition: an unidentified person is sb whose name is not known because police or government officials have been unable to find out who they are, or have not said who they are: chưa xác định
examples: Five men were wounded by an unidentified gunman in Belfast city centre yesterday.
The three bodies found in the river remain unidentified.
An unidentified caller contacted the police and gave the names of the men involved in the robbery.

children.name: incognito
children.definition: if a famous person goes somewhereincognito,they go there without telling people who they are : không để lộ tung tích.
examples: He tried to go incognito but his bizarre disguise made him stand out even more.

children.name: unknown
children.definition: an unknown person is sb whose name is not known because you do not know them or because they are not famous: vô danh
examples: She said the flowers were from an unknown admirer.
We met near the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.

children.name: unknown to
examples: Most of the stars in the movie are unknown to US audiences.

children.name: nameless
children.definition: a nameless person is one of many people who are not famous and whose names are not generally known: không tên, vô danh
examples: No one gives much thought to the nameless millions who work in our factories.

children.name: the nameless victims of the nation’s civil war
